result.execSummary:
The defendant William H Wilsey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per Remittitur dated October 22, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP001102-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDTED by this court in a decision filed onSeptember 6, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the hold previously imposed in this matter is lifted.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that appellate counsel, Attorney Michael J. Backes, is relieved of any further representation of William H. Wilsey on appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

Backes, is relieved of any further representation of William H. Wilsey on appeal. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt:
Additional statements by: Stellamarie G-W and Sandra K.
AS TO COUNT 1:
   The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to Count 2, with credit for 0 days time served.  Sentence is to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 8 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to Count 1, credit for 5 days. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 9/24/2023 (for both counts); nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 9/24/2023; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No contact with T.K., her family or her address. Court advised the defendant of the penalties if this order is violated.
-Sex Offender evaluation and any recommended treatment
*Defendant to Register with the Sex Offender Registry
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant William H Wilsey in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Arguments made by the State and defense. Case passed to 1:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Psychological Evaluation received and filed. sab

Defendant William H Wilsey in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, 5 and 6:
Pursuant to plea negotiations, Court ordered Counts 3, 4, 5 and 6 DISMISSED and READ IN.
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court advised the defendant that he is subject to the sex offender registry; he was also advised of the restriction on sex offenders working with children.
Court ordered Presentence Report at the request of the defense. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 9/24/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant William H Wilsey in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Filed, JusticePoint Violation Report.  State's motion for cash bail argued by counsel.  Court admonished defendant.  Case remains calendared on 8-4-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for final pretrial in Branch 15.

Filed, JusticePoint Violation Report.

Case set for final pretrial on 8-4-2015 at 8:30am.  Jury trial set for 8-31-2015 at 8:30am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 7-1-2015.

Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.
